ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint Wave data collected
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Trial number
Shape-Color Task: The units of reaction time
Total number of 'Shift' trials
Total number of 'No Shift' trials
Total number of both 'Shift' and 'No Shift' trials
Type of Trial #
Response time in Trial #
Accuracy in Trial #
Mean reaction time in correct 'Shift' trials
Mean reaction time in incorrect 'Shift' trials
Mean reaction time in correct 'No Shift' trials
Mean reaction time in incorrect 'No Shift' trials
Standard deviation of reaction time in correct 'Shift' trials
Standard deviation of reaction time in incorrect 'Shift' trials
Standard deviation of reaction time in correct 'No Shift' trials
Standard deviation of reaction time in incorrect 'No Shift' trials
Proportion of correct responses in 'Shift' trials
Proportion of correct responses in 'No Shift' trials
